subject: p19182863
History: History of multifocal pneumonia after CABG, now presenting with symptoms concerning for CHF or pneumonia.
Findings: There is mild pulmonary edema. A moderate right pleural effusion is not significantly changed. A consolidation at right base is not definitive on this examination however is confirmed on the subsequent CT. No pneumothorax is seen. There is moderate cardiomegaly with tortuosity of the aorta. The patient is status post median sternotomy with CABG and valve replacements.
Impression: Mild pulmonary edema with right pleural effusion. Consolidation at right base is not definitive on this examination however is confirmed on the subsequent CT.
